      • generateObjects

        public java.lang.String generateObjects()
        Generates bibliographic objects and users.
        pre:
        None.
        post:
        Bibliographic objects and users are generated.
        Returns:
        A string representation of the generated objects.

      • searchBP

        public BibliographicProduct searchBP(java.lang.String id)
        Search for a bibliographic product by its ID.
        pre:
        None.
        post:
        The bibliographic product corresponding to the ID is returned, if any.
        Parameters:
        id - The product ID to search for.
        Returns:
        The bibliographic product corresponding to the ID, or null if not found.

      • checkBP

        public java.lang.String checkBP(java.lang.String id)
        Verify the type of bibliographic product by its ID.
        pre:
        None.
        post:
        A message is returned indicating the bibliographic product type corresponding to the ID, if any.
        Parameters:
        id - The product ID to verify.
        Returns:
        A message indicating the type of bibliographic product, or a message of non-existence if not found.

      • createBP

        public java.lang.String createBP(java.lang.String id,
                                 java.lang.String name,
                                 java.lang.String url,
                                 int pages,
                                 java.util.Calendar publication,
                                 double value,
                                 int pagesRead,
                                 java.lang.String review,
                                 int copiesSold,
                                 int genre)
        Create a book with the data provided.
        pre:
        There must be no bibliographic product with the ID provided.
        post:
        A new workbook is created and added to the product list.
        Parameters:
        id - The book ID.
        name - The name of the book.
        url - The URL of the book.
        pages - The number of pages in the book.
        publication - The publication date of the book.
        value - The value of the book.
        pagesRead - The number of pages read from the book.
        review - The book review.
        copiesSold - The number of copies sold of the book.
        genre - The genre of the book.
        Returns:
        A message indicating if the book was successfully created or if a product already exists with the ID provided.

      • createBP

        public java.lang.String createBP(java.lang.String id,
                                 java.lang.String name,
                                 java.lang.String url,
                                 int pages,
                                 java.util.Calendar publication,
                                 double value,
                                 int pagesRead,
                                 int category,
                                 java.lang.String periodicityEmission,
                                 int activeSubscriptions)
        Create a magazine with the data provided.
        pre:
        There must be no bibliographic product with the ID provided.
        post:
        A new magazine is created and added to the product list.
        Parameters:
        id - The magazine ID.
        name - The name of the magazine.
        url - The URL of the magazine.
        pages - The number of pages of the magazine.
        publication - The publication date of the magazine.
        value - The value of the magazine.
        pagesRead - The number of pages read from the magazine.
        category - The magazine category.
        periodicityEmission - The periodicity of issue of the magazine.
        activeSubscriptions - The number of active magazine subscriptions.
        Returns:
        A message indicating whether the magazine was successfully created or whether a product already exists with the ID provided.

      • updateBP

        public java.lang.String updateBP(java.lang.String id,
                                 java.lang.String name,
                                 java.lang.String url,
                                 int pages,
                                 java.util.Calendar publication,
                                 double value,
                                 int pagesRead,
                                 java.lang.String review,
                                 int copiesSold,
                                 int genre)
        Updates the data in a book.
        pre:
        There must be a book with the ID provided.
        post:
        The data of the book corresponding to the ID is updated.
        Parameters:
        id - The book ID to update.
        name - The new name of the book.
        url - The new URL of the book.
        pages - The new number of pages in the book.
        publication - The new publication date of the book.
        value - The new value of the book.
        pagesRead - The new number of pages read from the book.
        review - The new book review.
        copiesSold - The new number of copies sold of the book.
        genre - The new genre of the book.
        Returns:
        A message indicating the initial and updated data of the book.

      • updateBP

        public java.lang.String updateBP(java.lang.String id,
                                 java.lang.String name,
                                 java.lang.String url,
                                 int pages,
                                 java.util.Calendar publication,
                                 double value,
                                 int pagesRead,
                                 int category,
                                 java.lang.String periodicityEmission,
                                 int activeSubscriptions)
        Updates the data of a magazine.
        pre:
        There must be a magazine with the ID provided.
        post:
        The data of the magazine corresponding to the ID is updated.
        Parameters:
        id - The magazine ID to update.
        name - The new name of the magazine.
        url - The new URL of the magazine.
        pages - The new number of pages of the magazine.
        publication - The magazine's new publication date.
        value - The new value of the magazine.
        pagesRead - The new number of pages read from the magazine.
        category - The new category of the magazine.
        periodicityEmission - The new issue periodicity of the magazine.
        activeSubscriptions - The new number of active magazine subscriptions.
        Returns:
        A message indicating the initial and updated data of the magazine.

      • removeBP

        public java.lang.String removeBP(java.lang.String id)
        Delete a bibliographic product by its ID.
        pre:
        There must be a bibliographic product with the ID provided.
        post:
        The bibliographic product corresponding to the ID is deleted and the associated subscriptions are cancelled.
        Parameters:
        id - The product ID to remove.
        Returns:
        A message indicating if the product was successfully removed or if no product was found with the ID provided.

      • existUser

        public boolean existUser(java.lang.String id)
        Checks if a user with the given ID exists.
        pre:
        None.
        post:
        Returns true if a user with the given ID exists, false otherwise.
        Parameters:
        id - The ID of the user to check.
        Returns:
        True if a user with the given ID exists, false otherwise.

      • createUser

        public java.lang.String createUser(int type,
                                   java.lang.String name,
                                   java.lang.String id)
        Creates a new user with the given type, name, and ID.
        pre:
        There should not be an existing user with the provided ID.
        post:
        Creates a new user and adds it to the user list.
        Parameters:
        type - The type of the user (1 for Regular, 2 for Premium).
        name - The name of the user.
        id - The ID of the user.
        Returns:
        A message indicating if the user was created successfully or if a user with the entered ID already exists.

      • buyBP

        public java.lang.String buyBP(int type,
                              java.lang.String idUser,
                              java.lang.String idBP)
        Performs the purchase of books or magazine subscriptions.
        pre:
        The user exists.
        post:
        The purchase is made, and the corresponding messages are returned.
        Parameters:
        type - The type of the purchase (1 for book, 2 for magazine).
        idUser - The ID of the user making the purchase.
        idBP - The ID of the bibliographic product being purchased.
        Returns:
        The message indicating the status of the purchase.

      • simulateReadingSession

        public java.lang.String simulateReadingSession(int page,
                                               java.lang.String idBP,
                                               java.lang.String idUser)
        Simulates a reading session.
        pre:
        The user and bibliographic product exist, and the page is valid.
        post:
        The reading session is simulated, and the corresponding message is returned.
        Parameters:
        page - The page number to start the reading session.
        idBP - The ID of the bibliographic product being read.
        idUser - The ID of the user performing the reading session.
        Returns:
        The message indicating the progress of the reading session.

        pre:
        The user exists.
        post:
        The user's library is displayed.
        Parameters:
        idUser - The ID of the user.
        page - The page number of the library to display.
        Returns:
        The message displaying the user's library.

      • goToSimulation

        public java.lang.String goToSimulation(java.lang.String idUser,
                                       java.lang.String input,
                                       int page)
        Goes to the simulation based on user input.
        pre:
        The user exists, and the input and page number are valid.
        post:
        The simulation is displayed.
        Parameters:
        idUser - The ID of the user.
        input - The input containing the bibliographic product ID.
        page - The page number to display in the simulation.
        Returns:
        The simulation message.

      • cancelSuscription

        public java.lang.String cancelSuscription(java.lang.String idUser,
                                          java.lang.String idM)
        Cancels a subscription.
        pre:
        The user and magazine exist.
        post:
        The subscription is canceled, and the corresponding message is returned.
        Parameters:
        idUser - The ID of the user.
        idM - The ID of the magazine subscription to cancel.
        Returns:
        The cancellation message.

        pre:

        post:

        Returns:
        The message displaying the total number of pages read.

      • totalPagesReadGenreCategory

        public java.lang.String totalPagesReadGenreCategory()
        Calculates the total number of pages read for each genre and category of products.
        pre: The 'products' list is not null.
        post: Returns a formatted string displaying the most read category for books and the most read genre for magazines.
        Returns:
        A string containing the most read category for books and the most read genre for magazines.

      • top5

        public java.lang.String top5(int typeBP)
        Retrieves the top 5 most read books or magazines based on the specified type.
        pre: The 'products' list is not null.
        post: Returns a string listing the top 5 most read books or magazines.
        Parameters:
        typeBP - An integer representing the type of bibliographic product (1 for books, 2 for magazines).
        Returns:
        A string listing the top 5 most read books or magazines.

      • totalSalesSuscription

        public double[] totalSalesSuscription(int opt)
        Calculates the total sales or subscriptions based on the specified option.
        pre: The 'users' list is not null.
        post: Returns an array of doubles representing the total sales or subscriptions.
        Parameters:
        opt - An integer representing the option to calculate total sales (1) or subscriptions (2).
        Returns:
        An array of doubles representing the total sales or subscriptions.

      • bookCopiesSold

        public java.lang.String bookCopiesSold()
        Generates a sales report for books, displaying the number of copies sold for each genre.
        pre: The 'products' list is not null.
        post: Returns a formatted string displaying the sales report by genre for books.
        Returns:
        A string containing the sales report by genre for books.

      • magazineSuscriptionActive

        public java.lang.String magazineSuscriptionActive()

        post: Returns a formatted string displaying the subscriptions report by category for magazines.
        Returns:

        Returns a promotional message if the user is a regular user.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
